abstract:
A 62-year-old Indian male with diabetes mellitus presented with atypical, overlap features of Aspergillus hypersensitivity syndrome and obstructing bronchial aspergillosis.
He was febrile and tachypnoeic with diffuse crepitations and wheezing. Chest X-ray was normal but eosinophil count was 2900/mm3 and Ig E > 10,000 IU/ml.
He responded initially to high dose steroid therapy but deteriorated subsequently from extensive mucus plugging of the bronchial tree which resulted in respiratory failure and death. He was HIV-negative.
Culture and histologic examination of bronchoscopically identified tracheobronchial mucus plugs should be performed as early treatment may be life-saving.
title: A case report of Aspergillus hypersensitivity syndrome with obstructing bronchial aspergillosis.
